channel.title: BBC News - World
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Russian oil: EU agrees compromise deal on banning imports
item.description: The latest round of EU-wide sanctions excludes pipeline oil imports after Hungary opposed a total ban.

item.title: Shanghai lockdown: China eases Covid restrictions after two months
item.description: China's biggest city, a vital global trade hub, begins to relax crippling Covid restrictions.

item.title: Rain storm claims 100 lives in north-east Brazil
item.description: Landslides and torrents of mud triggered by rain demolish poor neighbourhoods and shanty towns.

item.title: Clinton lawyer cleared of lying to FBI over Trump
item.description: Michael Sussman stood charged with lying to the FBI and concealing ties to Hillary Clinton's campaign.

item.title: Nepal plane crash: Officials recover black box from wreckage
item.description: Hopes of any survivors were dashed as the remains of all 22 people onboard have also been found.

item.title: Iran lied about banned nuclear activity using stolen documents - Israel
item.description: Israel's PM shows what he says is proof that Iran deceived the world's nuclear agency.

item.title: Mexico's Maya train project stalls as legal battle drags
item.description: A judge delivers a fresh blow to the project which aims to link archaeological sites with beach resorts.

item.title: Champions League final: Uefa commissions independent report into scenes outside stadium
item.description: Uefa commissions an independent report into the scenes that delayed Saturday's Champions League final between Liverpool and Real Madrid.

item.title: Australia election: PM Anthony Albanese secures majority government
item.description: The results in many seats had been unclear after a record vote for independents and minor parties.

item.title: Iran building collapse: Protesters turn on government over disaster
item.description: Nightly protests continue as Iranians seethe, a week after the deadliest building collapse in years.

item.title: Sidhu Moose Wala: Murdered India singer hit by 24 bullets, says report
item.description: Video footage of Sidhu Moose Wala's car shows it was sprayed with bullets.

item.title: BTS: 'K-Wave' arrives at White House with anti-Asian hate summit
item.description: K-pop stars BTS are taking a break from music to help the White House take on anti-Asian crimes.

item.title: 'I watched from afar Russia’s latest merciless assault on Severodonetsk'
item.description: Quentin Sommerville describes relentless artillery bombardment in Donbas ahead of Russian forces entering Severodonetsk.

item.title: What do Russian papers say about sanctions?
item.description: As the EU announces new penalties, Steve Rosenberg looks at what Russian media has to say.

item.title: Ukraine war: Refugee from Popasna spots looted possessions on Russian tank
item.description: The Ukrainian says she recognises items from her house on a Russian tank, including a new boiler.

item.title: How India’s first all-women newsroom is creating a media revolution
item.description: Khabar Lahariya is the first and only newsroom in India run entirely by women from marginalised backgrounds.

item.title: Borgen: How the Danish political drama has been 'reinvented'
item.description: The series returns to Netflix this week, nearly a decade after its highly-praised original run.

item.title: Sidhu Moose Wala: Controversial Indian rapper who made waves with his music
item.description: Shubhdeep Singh Sidhu, popularly known as Sidhu Moose Wala, was murdered in Punjab on Sunday.

item.title: Sudan or Chad? Why a Darfur sultan regrets a twist of colonial fate
item.description: A traditional leader feels his people were dealt a cruel blow when absorbed into Sudan a century ago.

item.title: Ukraine may soon get US long-range MLRS rocket system
item.description: The US looks set to send the weaponry, but Russia warns it would be a provocative escalation.

item.title: Champions League final: Fan videos of crowding and pepper spray
item.description: Footage from fans attending the Champions League final shows scenes of chaos.

item.title: The dangerous world of illegal mining in South Africa
item.description: BBC Africa Eye meets the migrants who risk everything to go deep underground in South Africa’s abandoned gold mines.

item.title: Death toll rises after Brazil landslides
item.description: Rescue efforts continue in the state of Pernambuco, with at least 79 people are known to have died.

item.title: Ukraine's President Zelensky makes rare visit to Kharkiv frontline
item.description: Ukraine's President Zelensky walks around Kharkiv before meeting soldiers and presenting them with medals.

item.title: Ukraine war: BBC interview with Russian ambassador to the UK
item.description: In a BBC interview, Andrei Kelin is shown CCTV footage of Russian soldiers committing alleged war crimes.
